title: National Pearl Harbor Remembrance Day, 2025
summary: Proclamation 10996 of December 5, 2025, designates December 7, 2025, as National Pearl Harbor Remembrance Day. The proclamation commemorates the unprovoked attack on Pearl Harbor on December 7, 1941, which claimed the lives of 2,403 Americans and propelled the nation into World War II. It highlights the courage and sacrifices of the Greatest Generation, the transformation of Japan from aggressor to ally, and the enduring lessons of vigilance and readiness. The proclamation encourages Americans to observe the day with solemnity, honor military personnel, and fly the U.S. flag at half-staff.
